definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: The tea, though freshly brewed, still tastes thick and stale.
sentences.chinese: 新沏的茶水喝起來卻仍舊厚重滯澀。

sentences.english: She made me some green tea after dinner.
sentences.chinese: 喫完飯後她給我沏了一壺綠茶。

sentences.english: The __tea art performances_ show how to make a perfect cup of tea with beautiful tea sets.
sentences.chinese: 茶藝表演展示了用漂亮的茶具沏一杯極好的茶的方法。

sentences.english: Please make me a fresh pot of tea.
She makes tea for the boss the first thing at work every day.
sentences.chinese: 她每天上班的第一件事就是給老闆沏好茶。

sentences.english: The Angels sit with you and begin to make tea and offer you a cup.
sentences.chinese: 天使們坐在你身旁，開始沏茶，遞給你一杯沏好的茶。

sentences.english: Green tea is brewed just like you would brew the tea you normally drink, except you will not want the water to boil.
sentences.chinese: 沏綠茶的方法和沏普通茶一樣，只是水不要做開。

sentences.english: Green tea is brewed just like you would brew the tea you normally drink, except you will not want the water to boil.
sentences.chinese: 沏綠茶的方法和沏普通茶一樣，只是水不要做開。

sentences.english: Longjing tea Brewed in a red teapot has a stronger Chinese flavour.
sentences.chinese: 用紫砂茶壺沏泡龍井茶，可使其更具有中國風味。

definition: tea prepared in large quantity using inexpensive tea leaves
biluochun or pi lo chun, a type of green tea grown in the Dongting Mountain region near Lake Tai 太湖[Tai4 Hu2], Jiangsu
tea and cake/refreshments/tea and dimsun 點心|点心, traditional Hong Kong lunch
